name: prattle
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to talk in a silly way or like a child for a long time about things that are not important or without saying anything important: She'd have prattled on about her new job for the whole afternoon if I'd let her. Stop your prattling and go to sleep! Synonyms
blabber informal
chatter
prate old-fashionedCompare
gabble verb mainly UK
gibber mainly disapproving

Related word
prattler
a lot of silly talk about things that are not important: His speech contained nothing new and was full of political prattle and clichés. I shouldn't waste your precious time with my endless prattle. Synonym
chatter Compare
gabble noun
More examplesFewer examplesDon't interrupt me with your childish prattle.Some of what they're saying is just mindless prattle.The spectators were subjected to a stream of non-stop prattle over the public-address system.
